messages.title: This is your chance to change Britain's future.
messages.content: If you are unhappy with the way things are going on Brexit and on the NHS, then this is your moment. The choice could not be clearer.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A vote for me will get you a Liberal Democrat MP who is not afraid to stick to his principles. I will stand up against this Tory Government and its hard Brexit plans.
I will stand up against damaging cuts to our NHS and schools.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The election is going to be a close finish between me and Labour. If Labour wins, nothing will change.

issues.brexitEurope: A Labour vote will mean more of the same. Your Labour MP supported Brexit in the referendum, and voted with UKIP and the Conservatives to give Theresa May a Brexit blank cheque.
issues.education: I will stand up against damaging cuts to our NHS and schools.
issues.government: I will stand up against this Tory Government and its hard Brexit plans.
issues.health: If you are unhappy with the way things are going on the NHS, then this is your moment. I will stand up against damaging cuts to our NHS.

community.content: I have already hit the ground running campaigning for local people. You may have seen my team out on the streets campaigning.

leaflet.personalStatement: If you want an MP that listens to you, make your vote count and choose me on the 8th of June.

quotes.text: This is your chance to change Britain's future.

examples: This is your chance to change Britain's future.
A Labour vote will mean more of the same.
If you are unhappy with the way things are going on Brexit and on the NHS, then this is your moment.
You may have seen my team out on the streets campaigning.
This is your chance to change Britain's future.
If you are unhappy with the way things are going on Brexit and on the NHS, then this is your moment.
A Labour vote will mean more of the same.
I will stand up against damaging cuts to our NHS and schools.

personalStories.story: I have already hit the ground running campaigning for local people.

examples: A Labour vote will mean more of the same.
I will stand up against damaging cuts to our NHS and schools.
Every time we need Jeremy Corbyn's Labour Party to stand up to this Government they fail.
Your Labour MP supported Brexit in the referendum, and voted with UKIP and the Conservatives to give Theresa May a Brexit blank cheque.
Remember that your Labour MP voted for Brexit in the referendum, and UKIP have chosen not to stand a candidate against him: Can you really support an MP backed by UKIP?
